subject: Re: [junit] Re: your opinion needed: package for unit testing codes
msgSnippet: ... Google JUnitX. Even better, recognize that if you want to test a private method, then that method is /probably/ in the wrong class: it might belong to
messageBody:
dguv200 wrote:

> lets say i am a bit new on the workings of junit..so how is it that
> one can test a private method...just to make sure it does what it is
> supposed to do.

Google JUnitX.

Even better, recognize that if you want to test a private method, then
that method is /probably/ in the wrong class: it might belong to another
class with which its current class collaborates. If so, extract that
class, at which point the method will be promoted to the public
interface, and your problem goes away.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
